subject: RE: [junit] Testing with a ResultSet
msgSnippet: What about creating a MockResultSet that implements the ResultSet interface that has the behaviour you require. You only need to write the class to give the
messageBody:
What about creating a MockResultSet that implements the ResultSet interface
that has the behaviour you require. You only need to write the class to give
the appearance of a 'real' ResultSet rather thatn the functionality.
joe

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Thomas Saxtoft [mailto:ts@...]
> Sent: 16 January 2002 09:27
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Testing with a ResultSet
>
>
> Hi
>
> I'm going to test a method which takes a ResultSet as a
> parameter. What
> is the best way to do this. I was thinking about making a query to the
> database, but then I can't be sure always to get the same ResultSet
> back.
>
> What's the most "right way" to do it?
>
> Thank you,
>
> Thomas Saxtoft
